titleStmt.title: John Bailey et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10671

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excelency Beriah Magoffin Esqr --
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Whereas John Robberts was indicted one at the May term of the owsley Circuit Court 1861 was tried and found guilty of carrying consealed deadly weapons to wit a pistol. ^and fined $50.^ your petitioners would respectfully state to your Excelency that he is a very pore man with a wife and several small children. owing to the scarsety of money and his poverty if the Collection of sd fine is forced he would be forced to go to prison for sd fine
now we your petitioner would respectfully request your Excellency to remit so much of sd fine as your Excelency has the power to remit believing t is a case worthy of your Excelencys Clemency

John Bailey=
E Main
T J Greer
John W Brandenburgh
Joseph Rellner
Shelton White
T Stone
L. W. Blount
B N Lutz
Ben Mcgee
